alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:54AM EST until January 14 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern Erie county. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 4 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A significant lake effect snow band will develop over the eastern basin of Lake Erie today into Sunday. Southwest winds should keep the most significant snowfall over Lake Erie, offshore of Erie County, PA. However, there will be a brief window tonight where snow will enter the northern portion of the county. The highest accumulations will be near the lakeshore, east of I-79 and north of I-90.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
